name: Delvin Mallory

aspects.high_concept: Veteran Guild Fixer and Information Broker
aspects.trouble: Too Many Contacts, Too Many Debts
other_aspects: Secretly Worried About the Guild's Future

stunts: Well Connected: +2 to Contacts when seeking information from criminal networks
Silver Tongue: +2 to Deceive or Rapport when making deals or negotiations
Fence Network: Can fence any stolen goods and has contacts in all major cities
notes: Delvin Mallory is a veteran member of the Thieves Guild, a Breton with decades of experience in the criminal underworld. He serves as the guild's primary information broker and fixer, maintaining contacts across Skyrim. While he still operates as a fence and assigns jobs, he's secretly worried about the guild's declining fortunes. Delvin is friendly, professional, and enjoys telling stories about the 'old days' when the guild was at its peak. He eventually becomes a key ally in restoring the guild's influence.
combat_tactics: Delvin avoids combat whenever possible. If forced to fight, he uses misdirection and calls for backup. He's more valuable for his contacts than his fighting skills.
social_interaction: Delvin is friendly, talkative, and enjoys sharing stories. He speaks with a warm tone and often references the guild's glory days. He's professional in his dealings but personable with those he trusts. Despite his worries about the guild, he maintains an optimistic facade and works tirelessly to keep operations running.

relationships.Mercer Frey: Guild Master, professional respect (unaware of betrayal)
relationships.Karliah: Former guild member (believes traitor story initially)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Friendly, storytelling, nostalgic. Uses terms like 'lad' and 'lass'.
quirks: Always knows someone who knows someone
personality_notes.character_growth: Eventually helps restore guild influence across Skyrim, proving his network still has value

story_hooks: Assigns city influence jobs to expand guild operations
Provides contacts and information for heists
Shares stories about guild's glory days
Helps restore guild influence in major cities
Eventually aids in exposing Mercer's betrayal

dialogue_samples.greeting: Well hello there, lad/lass! Come to hear some stories or do some business?
dialogue_samples.job_assignment: I've got some work that needs doing in the city. Interested?
dialogue_samples.nostalgia: Back in the day, this guild had influence in every hold. We'll get there again, mark my words.
dialogue_samples.guild_loyalty: I've given my life to this guild. I'll see it restored if it's the last thing I do.
